Title: TMSNC: Execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow in TMSNC might lead to the execution of arbitrary code
    when processing an instant message.

Background.Text: TMSNC is a Textbased client for the MSN instant messaging protocol.

Description.Text: Nico Golde reported a stack-based buffer overflow when processing a MSN packet with a UBX command containing a large UBX payload length field.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted message, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Since TMSNC is no longer maintained, we recommend that users unmerge
    the vulnerable package and switch to another console-based MSN client
    such as CenterIM or Pebrot:
